Description: Body sherd of Corinthian black-figured pottery globular aryballos; exterior: narrow band at top; below, black-figure decoration consisting of warriors marching to right (only head with helmet in added red, upper part of shield with red and spear of one hoplite remaining); mere trace of companion on right remaining; incised blob rosette and blob as filling decoration in field.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Dr David George Hogarth
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 54-5, no. A13)
Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p. 217, no. 2)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GB.124) (Phase 1)
CVA Oxford II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Great Britain 9 Oxford fasicule 2 (p. 72, pl. VI, no. 21)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
